Instructional Design Specialist, gTech Ads Training Google August 2011  –  June 2015  (3 years 11 months) Began by consulting on an eLearning initiative to produce scalable and measurable eLearning programs for online advertising products. I worked for a year as project manager to develop these programs, then focused on instructional design and ensuring quality and consistency across training programs.  
 
With the eLearning initiative, the team was able to sunset live classroom training and save 3 full-time employees. Summary Hard work and commitment have enabled me to achieve outstanding results in my career to date. I derive great satisfaction from excelling in whatever I do while, at the same time, enjoying a healthy work-life balance. 
 
I enjoy working as part of a team as it allows me to express my outgoing personality. I posses high levels of integrity, excellent communication skills and an empathetic disposition. 
 
I have the ability to reflect critically and philosophically on problems. I am able to quickly grasp the core issues of a predicament and deliver meaningful solutions.  
 
I have a strong value system; I am a very responsible person both personally and professionally. 
 
I attach a lot of importance to the personal relationships that I create with others. I love meeting new people, travelling and experiencing new cultures. I have a wide range of friends and a diverse range of interests. I love cycling, swimming, walking and other outdoor activities. When at home, I like to unwind by reading, playing music, or relaxing with friends.

Work on various projects supporting the People Dev and Global Learning Dev teams. 
 
Developed online interactive-video “gSkills” assessment modules. These modules are used to assess the skills of Googlers allowing them to choose the appropriate learning path for further education.  
Modules included: Adapting your Communication Skills and Negotiation Skills.  
Development tasks included:  
• Creation of interactive scripts that allow the user to choose various paths in the assessment.  
• Auditioned and chose actors to portray the characters with which the Googlers interact.  
• Directed (and played a role in) the various video segments.  
• Worked with the technology team to perform Q&A to test the various paths. 
 
Developed online training modules for Emotional Intelligence and C-Level Conversations.  
These modules are used to allow Googlers to access training online rather than attending half-day sessions of instructor-led training.  
Development for both modules included: 
• Editing video of the presenter to include in the on-demand training. 
• Integrating the presentation with video/audio and interactions/activities using Articulate Storyline. 
 
Created 5 blended learning sales courses including: Opening and Effective Questioning, Solution Selling, Objection Handling, Closing the Deal, and Selling with Emotional Intelligence. 
Development tasks included:  
• Worked with SMEs to create facilitator guides, participant guides, and supporting slides. 
• Created online Learning Paths for each topic that followed the Overview→Learn→Apply→Get More structure. 
• Led the Train-the-Trainer sessions for the Googlers who will be training these topics going forward. 
Dev tools: Articulate, Storyline, Captivate, Camtasia, Snagit, Photoshop, Google Docs, Word/Excel/Pwrpnt, Sound and video editing software (FCP7, Adobe Premiere)

Project Manager - DoubleClick Training Global Certification Google January 2013  –  December 2013  (1 year) Greater New York City Area Launched the first DoubleClick Online Training exam certification across six products. Project Lead - DoubleClick Online Global Learning Program Google January 2012  –  December 2013  (2 years) Greater New York City Area Led strategy to develop the first DoubleClick online learning program across eight products, localized in nine languages. Moving training online enabled the training team to reach global audiences and emerging markets more efficiently, while improving the quality of instruction and deprecating live classroom training. Built out all design templates, adopted file hosting solution, and worked with developer to create authentication portal on App Engine. Worked with trainers and contractors to perform deep instructional design analysis, write scripts and storyboards, design infographics, create videos, develop screen-capture tutorials, build c-sat surveys, and QA and assemble files for publication and localization using an internal content-management system. This program yielded high engagement and satisfaction rates across products, training over 8,000 users in two years with a 825% increase in YOY growth and over 900% growth in attendance compared to live classroom training. Project Manager - DoubleClick Online Registration System Google April 2011  –  December 2011  (9 months) Greater New York City Area Led strategy to develop home-grown online course registration system that supported nine DoubleClick products across live classroom, webinar, and e-learning. This system enabled the training team to migrate off a third-party learning management system that was expensive, had security vulnerabilities, problems syncing with Google systems, and was inefficient to administer. Worked with developers to fork gLearn internal code base and create secure instance for external use on google.com domain. Proposed initial strategy, specked out user interface, hired contract developer in Hyderabad, worked with developers on custom features, tracked progress, and successfully launched the system internationally. To date, the system has enrolled over 8,000 registrants, saving 1 FTE in datafeed troubleshooting and trainer administration, as well as over $40,000 in contract savings. Proposed and specked out associated dashboard initiative to aggregate registration data and save every trainer an estimated two hrs/wk. Project Lead - Learn Center Administration Google October 2008  –  December 2011  (3 years 3 months) Greater New York City Area Took over ownership of legacy third-party learning management system to provide a stable global platform for online training materials. Worked with six product teams to develop custom learning paths featuring interactive video and content tracking that increased traffic 363% five weeks after launch. Worked with developers on script to whitelist internal users, reducing internal access request support tickets by an estimated 75%. Worked with EMEA partners to create JSON script that allowed trainers to update content from Google Spreadsheets thereby saving trainers an estimated two hours per week. Worked with vendor to revise platform code to allow deep linking from our Help Centers and product to their learning platform. Created Google Desktop gadget to promote updated articles in Learn and Help Centers. Worked with SecOps and vendor to patch security vulnerabilities and remain Google compliant. Worked with EMEA support to design dynamic article suggestions banner that utilized DoubleClick tracking technologies. Collaborated with developers on an internal cross-browser extension that tracked whether customers clicked on Help links included in support tickets. Performed tests of Help Center search to identify problems with hosting of DoubleClick instances, which resulted in reducing search exits by an average of 25% to 33% on most heavily-trafficked Help Centers. Summary I am a professional Instructional Designer and Curriculum Developer with 10+ years experience developing and delivering eLearning and ILT instruction across various industries. I specialize in creating technical training, procedures and documentation that is engaging and accessible to the learner. I possess a thorough knowledge and understanding of systematic instructional design models such as ADDIE and Dick and Carey for use in creating instructional materials. I regularly apply these theories to curriculum design and understand the impact on the outcome of instruction. I create experiences which make knowledge and skill transfer more efficient, effective, and engaging for the learner. I use pedagogical processes to determine the current state and needs of the learner, define the end goal, and address the learning gap with directly observable and measurable methods of instruction. I work comfortably in fast-paced, deadline oriented work environments and am a top performer amidst ever-changing demands.
